titles.title: For the relief of Elizabeth M. Hill.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations.
Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 103-603.

calendar.text: Placed on the Private Calendar, Calendar No. 11.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice.
Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice. Approved for full committee consideration without amendment favorably.

calendar.text: Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Biden without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 690.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 2/3/1993--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to pay a specified sum plus interest to a named individual in satisfaction of a claim against the United States for the value of medical care and treatment.
